title: Gap in per capita incomes, East Asia and Africa

content.prompt: The graph above indicates which of the following?

choices.label: The peoples of sub-Saharan Africa have been more affected by twentieth-century warfare than the peoples of East Asia.
United States aid programs have favored East Asian countries at the expense of sub-Saharan countries.
Per capita incomes in East Asia and sub-Saharan Africa have been rising steadily since independence.
The gap between per capita incomes in East Asia and sub-Saharan Africa appears to be widening.
Western technology has been largely rejected by countries in sub-Saharan Africa.

skill.text: Skill 5.A: Identify patterns among or connections between historical developments and processes.
